intro: Trichosanthes, commonly known as the snake gourd, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its long, vine-like stems and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that eventually develop into elongated, cylindrical fruits. Trichosanthes species are native to Asia and are often cultivated for their edible fruits. The plant has also been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
